dolda.xiphutil

Class VorbisStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • dolda.xiphutil.VorbisStream

  • public class VorbisStream
extends java.lang.Object
    The VorbisStream class provides a convenient means of decoding Vorbis data. It can be constructed either from a PacketStream object which can come from any source, or from a normal Java IO InputStream object. In the latter case, it will treat the data as Ogg data and construct a PacketStream accordingly.

    Decoded data can be fetched either as arrays of floats, representing individual samples, using the decode() function, or a Java IO InputStream can be fetched, which will emit a 16-bit little endian PCM stream.

    After a VorbisStream object has been constructed, it will immediately provide the metadata from the Vorbis stream in public fields. See uc, vnd, chn and rate for details.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int chn
      The number of channels in this Vorbis data.
      int rate
      The sampling frequency of the Vorbis data in Hertz.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> uc
      A java.util.Map instance, providing the Vorbis comments as key-value pairs decoded as normal java.lang.Strings.
      java.lang.String vnd
      A string identifying the program and/or library which encoded the Vorbis data.

    • Field Detail

      • uc

        public final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> uc
        A java.util.Map instance, providing the Vorbis comments as key-value pairs decoded as normal java.lang.Strings. The keys are guaranteed to be lower case and interned, and the values are exactly as provided from the Vorbis comment. Please see the Vorbis documentation for more information on standardized keys.

      • vnd

        public final java.lang.String vnd
        A string identifying the program and/or library which encoded the Vorbis data.

      • chn

        public final int chn
        The number of channels in this Vorbis data. One channel means monaural sound, and two channels means stereo sound, but do note that other values may occur as well.

      • rate

        public final int rate
        The sampling frequency of the Vorbis data in Hertz.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VorbisStream

        public VorbisStream(PacketStream in)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a VorbisStream from a PacketStream. The constructor will have ensured that the fields containing the Vorbis metadata have been initialized when it returns.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the PacketStream itself throws an IOException.
        FormatException - if a format error is found in the input.

      • VorbisStream

        public VorbisStream(java.io.InputStream in)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a VorbisStream from a Java IO InputStream. The data from the stream will be decoded as Ogg data containing Vorbis. The constructor will have ensured that the fields containing the Vorbis metadata have been initialized when it returns.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the InputStream itself throws an IOException.
        FormatException - if a format error is found in the input.

    • Method Detail

      • decode

        public float[][] decode()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Perform a decode cycle. The return value is an array of float arrays. It contains one float array for each channel in the Vorbis stream, each of which contains one float for each sample. Each sample ranges from -1.0 to 1.0.

        The array is guaranteed to contain as many sample arrays as the chn field indicates. The sample arrays are also guaranteed to be of pairwise equal length, and to contain at least one sample. Therefore, if buf is a returned value from this function, the expression buf[0].length is guaranteed to work for fetching the number of samples from this cycle.

        Returns:
        The decoded data, or null when the stream ends.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the backing input stream itself throws an IOException.
        FormatException - if a format error is found in the input.

      • pcmstream

        public java.io.InputStream pcmstream()
        Constructs and returns a java.io.InputStream which uses the decode() function to decode data, and encodes it as a 16-bit little endian byte stream of PCM data. The close function of the InputStream object will chain to the close() function of this VorbisStream object.
        Returns:
        A java.io.InputStream object from which the PCM stream can be read.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string description of this object.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        This function implements a main function that can be used for either testing the functionality of this VorbisStream implementation or individual Ogg/Vorbis files. It takes one command-line argument to be interpreted as the path to an Ogg/Vorbis file to be decoded into PCM data. The PCM data is output to standard output.

        You can use the sox program to play Ogg/Vorbis files with this class as well: 

         java dolda.xiphutil.VorbisStream test.ogg | sox -t .raw -r 44100 -sw -c 2 - -t ossdsp /dev/dsp
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the stream backing this object.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the backing input stream itself throws an IOException.
